page.title: 04INTERVIEW cont.
page.content: The farm is also important for dairy farming. The farm has twenty Friesian cattle. These can produce ten gallons each a day. The milk is sent to Grimsby Dairies. The previous tenant used to own sheep. The sheep could be sheared by a farm labourer at the rate of 104 to 120 a day.The wool was sent to Bradford.The sheep were sold,if they had to be at Brigg,Market Rasen and Barnetby markets. The cattle are fed on grass, cake and dairy nuts.They are given nuts in proportion to the amount of milk they produce.In 1960 they used to slaugter their own pigs with a stun gun loaded with chemicals.Now animals must be killed at a slaughter house.The cattle used to graze on the famous Cabourne grass which were supposedly the finest grasses in the country.Today only twelve acres remain.
